Use reverse osmosis: Reverse osmosis systems can be used to remove impurities from contaminated water by forcing it through a semipermeable membrane. This can be an effective method for obtaining clean drinking water.
Implement desalination plants: In areas where seawater is abundant, desalination plants can be built to remove salt and other impurities from seawater, providing clean drinking water.

Use water purification tablets: Water purification tablets can be used to remove impurities from contaminated water. These tablets contain chemicals that kill bacteria and viruses, making the water safe to drink.

Build water filtration systems: Water filtration systems can be built to remove impurities from contaminated water. These systems use filters to remove impurities and can be built using materials such as sand, gravel, and activated carbon.

Use UV light disinfection: Ultraviolet (UV) light disinfection can be used to kill bacteria and viruses in contaminated water. This method is effective in removing impurities and can be used in conjunction with other methods.
